title: The Life and Works of Schubert - Jeremy Siepmann
description:
The life of Franz Schubert has been a gift to romantically inclined biographers: the beautiful, brilliant, modest boy who sprang to fully fledged genius at the age of sixteen; the quintessential ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“artist in a garretÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢, entirely consumed by his art and living a hand-to-mouth existence in Vienna; the gentle, cheerful, convivial young man who prized friendship almost as highly as music itself; the unworldly poet from whom great music poured like water from a fountain; the unrecognised master who died almost penniless at the age of thirty-one. And most of this is true. But as revealed in this dramatised biography (lavishly illustrated with musical examples), there was a secret, darker side to Schubert which only renders his story that much more fascinating.
